title: [BUG] The new packing mechanism for special packages is not packing the lipo'ed files
body:
**Description**

For example, the libHarfBuzzSharp.a in the root of iOS and the libSkiaSharp.dylib for macOS.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: But I notice the iOS framework is there... It is a folder, so maybe a clue...

comments.author: tmijieux
comments.body:
just this weekend i tried to build the complete nuget (bootstrapper.ps1 with -packall -buildall options) on windows,
using downloaded (--skipExternals=all) native bits, but there were no "lipo ed" files from the externals-download, instead there was a folder for each architecture, maybe this is related ...

I had to do some little local modifications in order to successfully build a nuget:
https://github.com/tmijieux/SkiaSharp/commit/7da746b4a907fe3172077d87235121c8ca8c2cc8

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body: Yeah, I think I mad a mistake somewhere. Bit of a bummer.
